progressInfo.title: Caloric Consumption
progressInfo.subtitle: How to monitor and analyze your daily caloric intake

overview.title: Caloric Consumption Overview
overview.description: This chart shows your daily calorie consumption, allowing you to analyze patterns and trends over time.

tracking.title: Calorie Tracking
tracking.description: Record all your meals daily to get a more accurate view of your caloric intake. Consistency is key to identifying patterns.

analysis.title: How to Analyze Data
analysis.description: Observe fluctuations in calorie consumption and correlate with your health and fitness goals. Adjust your diet as needed to achieve your goals.

periods.title: Viewing Periods
periods.description: Switch between different periods to analyze your caloric intake in the short and long term. Each view offers different perspectives on your eating habits.

tips.title: Healthy Eating Tips
tips.description: Remember that quality is as important as quantity. Focus on nutritious and varied foods, not just the total calories consumed.

overview.title: Progress Overview

modal.title: How we calculate your score
modal.subtitle: Understand how we evaluate your consistency

explanation.title: What is the consistency score?
explanation.description: The consistency score is a measure of how regular you are in your health habits, including workouts, nutrition, hydration, and daily steps.

calculation.title: How we calculate
calculation.description: We analyze your data from the last few weeks to create a score between 0 and 100 that reflects your regularity.

workout.title: Workout Consistency
workout.description: Based on how many days you worked out in recent weeks relative to your history.

nutrition.title: Nutritional Consistency
nutrition.description: How frequently you log your daily meals.

hydration.title: Hydration Consistency
hydration.description: How close you are to reaching your daily water goal.

activity.title: Daily Activity
activity.description: Based on your daily steps relative to your goal.

chart.noData: Add weight measurements to see your progress over time

progressInfo.title: Weight Tracking
progressInfo.subtitle: How to monitor and analyze your weight progress

overview.title: Weight Tracking Overview
overview.description: This chart shows your weight evolution over time, allowing you to identify patterns and trends.

tracking.title: Recording Your Weight
tracking.description: Record your weight daily for a more accurate view of your progress. Consistency is key to identifying patterns.

indicators.title: Key Indicators
indicators.description: The chart includes your current weight, target weight (if set), and the difference since the beginning of the selected period.

analysis.title: How to Analyze Data
analysis.description: Observe fluctuations in weight and correlate with your health and fitness goals. Adjust your diet and exercise routine as needed to achieve your goals.

periods.title: Viewing Periods
periods.description: Switch between different periods to analyze your weight progress in the short and long term. Each view offers different perspectives on your habits.

tips.title: Weight Management Tips
tips.description: Remember that weight is not the only measure of health. Focus on balanced nutrition, regular exercise, and a healthy lifestyle.

consistency.empty_state_description: Record your workouts, meals, and water intake to see your consistency score

infoCard.targetWeightError: Please set your current weight first

nutritionCard.caloriesNotConfigured: Your daily calories have not been configured yet
nutritionCard.setupNutrition: Set up your nutrition plan to see your daily needs.
nutritionCard.nutritionInfoSubtitle: Understand how each nutritional component affects your body and performance. Use this information to optimize your diet according to your goals.
nutritionCard.caloriesInfoDesc: Calories are the unit of energy your body needs to function. Your daily target is based on your age, weight, height, activity level, and fitness goals. A caloric deficit promotes weight loss, while a surplus aids muscle gain.
nutritionCard.proteinInfoDesc: Protein is essential for muscle building and repair. It's recommended to consume 1.6g to 2.2g per kg of body weight for those who regularly strength train. Good sources include lean meats, eggs, dairy products, legumes, and protein supplements.
nutritionCard.carbsInfoDesc: Carbohydrates are the body's primary energy source and are crucial for workout performance. Prioritize complex sources like brown rice, sweet potatoes, oats, and fruits. The ideal amount varies according to your goals and level of physical activity.
nutritionCard.fatInfoDesc: Fats are essential for hormone production and vitamin absorption. Prioritize healthy fats such as olive oil, avocados, nuts, and fatty fish. Ideally, fats should represent between 20-35% of your daily calories.
nutritionCard.waterInfoDesc: Proper hydration is crucial for all bodily processes, including muscle recovery and performance. It's recommended to consume 35-45ml per kg of body weight daily, increasing on days with intense workouts or hot weather.
nutritionCard.macrosBalanceDesc: The balance between protein, carbohydrates, and fats is fundamental to achieving your goals. For hypertrophy, a typical distribution is 30% protein, 40-50% carbohydrates, and 20-30% fats. Adjust this distribution according to your results and specific needs.

configSheet.title: Configure Workouts
configSheet.subtitle: Select and customize your workouts

configSheet.workoutNameError: Please enter a name for the workout

modal.title: Workout Progression
modal.noWorkoutsDescription: To suggest progressions, you need to have at least one previous workout recorded.
modal.selectExercisesDescription: Select the exercises you want to apply the suggested progression to:

alert.selectAtLeastOne: Select at least one suggestion to apply.
alert.applyFailed: Could not apply progressions. Please try again.

infoModal.title: About Suggestions
infoModal.subtitle: Suggestions are based on your workout history, but also consider:

smartProgression.title: Smart Progression
smartProgression.description: The algorithm analyzes up to 4 previous workouts to detect patterns, plateaus, and suggest the most appropriate progression.

adaptation.title: Adaptation
adaptation.description: Adjust weight, sets, and reps according to your current capacity, available equipment, and daily physical disposition.

perception.title: Perception
perception.description: Use your perceived effort as the main guide to determine the ideal progression. Try to progress gradually in each workout, whether by increasing load, sets, repetitions, or even the quality of each repetition's technique.

confirmDialog.title: Adjust Progression
confirmDialog.instruction: Review and adjust advanced settings before applying the suggested progression.

plateau.highReps: You've reached a good number of repetitions and are in a plateau. It's time to increase the weight to stimulate new growth.
plateau.notHighReps: Even without reaching 12 repetitions, you've been in a plateau for several workouts. Increasing the weight can help stimulate new progress.
plateau.repeatedWorkouts: You've been repeating the same workout for several sessions. To break the plateau, we suggest adding an additional set.
plateau.needMoreVolume: To continue evolving, we recommend adding an additional set to increase your training volume.
plateau.lowIntensity: Your training intensity is lower than ideal. Reduce rest time to increase workout density and take the last set to muscle failure.
plateau.lowReps: You're in a plateau with a moderate number of repetitions. Try increasing 1-2 repetitions in all sets and take the last one to muscle failure.
plateau.needBetterTechnique: To break this plateau, maintain the same weight and repetitions, but increase intensity by better controlling repetition timing (2s down, 1s up) and take the last set to failure.
plateau.combined: To break this plateau, we'll slightly adjust the weight and repetitions to create a new stimulus and take the last set to muscle failure.

scenarios.highRepsWithFailure: You trained to failure or very close to it and reached 12+ repetitions. Let's increase the weight and adjust the repetitions.
scenarios.highIntensity: You trained with very high intensity. We recommend maintaining the current weight and slightly increasing repetitions focusing on technique.
scenarios.goodReps: You've reached a good number of repetitions with moderate intensity. It's time to increase the load to stimulate new growth.
scenarios.nearTargetReps: You're training with good intensity. As you're close to 12 repetitions, we suggest a slight weight increase while maintaining repetitions, to prepare for the next phase.
scenarios.continueReps: Continue increasing repetitions with this weight to develop strength and technique.
scenarios.weightTooLight: The current weight is too light for you (high RIR and low effort). We recommend increasing the weight directly, even without reaching 12 repetitions.
scenarios.weightTooLightKeepReps: The weight is too light (high RIR and low effort). We recommend increasing the weight and trying to maintain the same number of repetitions.
scenarios.veryLowIntensity: You're training with very low intensity. We recommend a significant increase in the number of repetitions.
scenarios.targetReached: You've reached the target repetitions with moderate intensity. Let's increase the weight to continue progress.
scenarios.closeToTarget: You're close to the target repetitions. For this workout, we suggest slightly increasing the weight and maintaining repetitions.
scenarios.increaseReps: Continue gradually increasing repetitions with this weight.
scenarios.lowIntensityHighReps: You've reached the target repetitions with low intensity. It's time to significantly increase the weight.
scenarios.lowIntensityNearTarget: Your intensity is low. We suggest slightly increasing the weight and maintaining your current repetitions to better stimulate the muscle.
scenarios.lowIntensityLowReps: Your intensity is low. We recommend a significant increase in repetitions.

bodyweight.highReps: You've reached a high number of repetitions. Increase the exercise difficulty or reduce rest time between sets.
bodyweight.addSet: Add another set to increase your training volume and stimulate new muscle growth.
bodyweight.increaseReps: Increase the repetitions in all sets to progress in this bodyweight exercise.
bodyweight.highRepsNoWeight: Reduce rest time between sets to increase exercise intensity.
bodyweight.mediumReps: Continue increasing the number of repetitions in each set gradually.
bodyweight.lowReps: Focus on gradually increasing repetitions while maintaining good technical quality of the movement.
